alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Washington (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 22 at 2:27PM EDT until June 22 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT FOR WASHINGTON...SOUTHEASTERN MARTIN AND NORTHWESTERN BEAUFORT COUNTIES... At 226 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Powellsville to 6 miles west of Cape Colony to Pike Road, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Emergency management. This storm has a history of producing wind damage. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Williamston, Plymouth, Pinetown, Pike Road, Wenona, Hinson, Westover, Pleasant Grove, Terra Ceia, Scuppernong, Mackeys, Roper, Long Acre VFD, Jamesville, Smithwick and Dardens. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please send your reports of hail and/or wind damage, including trees or large limbs downed, by calling the National Weather Service office in Newport at 1-800-889-6889. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
